snippet: Industrial production has slowed to a crawl in Europe, slowly rebounded in the United States and continued to grow in emerging markets like India and China, data shows.
abstract: Floyd Norris Off The Charts column examines worldwide trends in industrial production, in years following collapse during financial crisis; notes that production has slowed to a crawl in Europe, gently rebounded in the United States, and continued rapid growth in emerging markets like China and India.
lead_paragraph: Industrial production has slowed to a crawl in Europe, slowly rebounded in the United States and continued to grow in emerging markets like India and China, data shows.

headline.print_headline: Factory Output Returns, But at Widely Different Rates
headline.main: Factory Output Returns, but at Widely Different Rates
